abstract: According to a complaint filed by the Securities and Exchange Commission, an employee of Bristol-Myers Squibb did little to cover his tracks when he engaged in an insider trading scheme that generated over $300,000 in profits.
snippet: According to a complaint filed by the Securities and Exchange Commission, an employee of Bristol-Myers Squibb did little to cover his tracks when he engaged in an insider trading scheme that generated over $300,000 in profits.
lead_paragraph: “Stupid Pet Tricks” has always been a favorite David Letterman sketch. The criminal insider trading charges filed against a Bristol-Myers Squibb executive, Robert D. Ramnarine, may well qualify for “Stupid Insider Trading Tricks.”

headline.main: Insider Trading Case Reveals a Dubious Scheme
